title: Miriam Margolyes ‘fat shamed’ Mr Tumble and viewers are having none of it
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Miriam Margoyles has been criticised by some viewers of The One Show after mocking Mr Tumble’s weight live on air.

The 78-year-old actress, known for starring in Harry Potter and Call The Midwife, appeared alongside children’s TV presenter Justin Fletcher aka Mr Tumble on Monday’s show (21 October).

In between the charity segments and pleasant vibes, Miriam turned the mood slightly awkward after making a jibe at Mr Tumble over his weight.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Asked about her upcoming shows, Miriam said: ‘I’m doing a series on obesity, about which I know a great deal being a very fat person.’

Miriam Margoyles on The One Show (Picture: BBC)

Turning to Mr Tumble, Miriam added: ‘You’re not slim are you?’

As the studio audience expressed a mix of chuckles and shock, the pair laughed it off, leaving the hosts to pay compliment to Mr Tumble.

‘He’s lovely, of course he is,’ Miriam added.

Mr Tumble and Miriam laughed off the comment (Picture: BBC)

Viewers however weren’t so pleased with the jab.

Miriam Margolyes just fat shamed Mr Tumble and tbh that actually upsets me because he seems like such a nice bloke and he did not deserve that #TheOneShow — Amba loves Mambo (@AmbaSeren) October 21, 2019

I don’t agree with fat shaming, no matter how famous you are. Shame on Miriam. #TheOneShow — Soph Beresford (@Soph_Beresford1) October 21, 2019

Bloody Hell she Fat shamed Mr Tumble 😱 #TheOneShow — RobBurp Ty (@robbobty64) October 21, 2019

As if she’s just called him fat on national television! #TheOneShow #BBC — Atholl (@AthollMills) October 21, 2019

Miriam has a history of unpredictability on live TV – having previously dropped a number of swear bombs before the watershed.

You can catch The One Show weekdays on BBC One at 7pm.
